 DzToolBar (const QString &label)

Detailed Description

Class that encapsulates a toolbar that contains DzAction items.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DzToolBar::DockArea

The areas where the tool bar can be docked.

Enumerator:
ToolBarTop 

The dock area at the top of the main window.

ToolBarBottom 

The dock area at the bottom of the main window.

ToolBarLeft 

A custom action item - a menu entry that activates a custom action. The dock area on the left side of the main window.

ToolBarRight 

A custom action item - a menu entry that activates a custom action. The dock area on the right side of the main window.

Member Function Documentation

void DzToolBar::clear (  )  [virtual, slot]

Removes all items from the bar.

void DzToolBar::dock ( DzToolBar::DockArea  area,
const QString &  beforeBar = QString::null 
) [slot]

Docks the tool bar in the specified area on the main window, and shows the tool bar if it is hidden.

Parameters:
area The DockArea to dock the toolbar to.
beforeBar The name of the bar in the area to dock before.
DzToolBarItem * DzToolBar::getItem ( int  which  )  const [slot]
Parameters:
which The index of the item in the menu
Returns:
A pointer to the toolbar item at the given index, NULL if the index is invalid
QObjectList DzToolBar::getItemList (  )  const [slot]

This function is provided for DAZ Script access. Plug-in developers are encouraged to use the much more efficient itemListIterator() method.

Returns:
A QObjectList of all the items in this bar.
int DzToolBar::getNumItems (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The number of items in the toolbar
bool DzToolBar::hasItems (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
true if there are items in this toolbar, false if the toolbar is empty.
void DzToolBar::insertAction ( const QString &  action,
int  index = -1 
) [slot]

Adds the given action to the tool bar.

Parameters:
action The class name of the DzAction that will be added to the tool bar.
index The index at which to insert the item, if the index is invalid (the default) the item is appended to the end of the menu.
void DzToolBar::insertCustomAction ( const QString &  action,
int  index = -1 
) [slot]

Adds the given custom action to the tool bar.

Parameters:
action The name of the custom action that will be added to the tool bar.
index The index at which to insert the item, if the index is invalid (the default) the item is appended to the end of the menu.
void DzToolBar::insertCustomWidget ( const QString &  uiScript,
int  index = -1 
) [slot]

Adds a custom widget to the tool bar.

Parameters:
uiScript A path to the DAZ Script that loads the QtDesigner .ui file for the custom widget. A global function named getWidget() is provided to uiScript that returns a DzWidget which should be used as the parent argument in a DzUiLoader::load() call.
index The index at which to insert the item, if the index is invalid (the default) the item is appended to the end of the menu.
void DzToolBar::insertDomElem ( QDomElement &  elem,
int  index = -1 
) [slot]

Generates a new tool bar item from the DOM (Document Object Model) element. This is used for building toolbars from XML. This function is intended for internal use, and so is not supported as part of the SDK.

Parameters:
elem The DOM element which defines the item that will be added to the toolbar.
index The index at which to insert the item, if the index is invalid (the default) the item is appended to the end of the menu.
void DzToolBar::insertItem ( DzToolBarItem *  item,
int  index = -1 
) [slot]

Inserts the given item into the tool bar at the given location.

Parameters:
item The item to insert into the tool bar
index The index at which to insert the item, if the index is invalid (the default) the item is appended to the end of the tool bar.
void DzToolBar::insertSeparator ( int  index = -1  )  [slot]

Adds a separator to the tool bar.

Parameters:
index The index at which to insert the item, if the index is invalid (the default) the item is appended to the end of the menu.
void DzToolBar::insertViewportAlignmentSpacer ( Qt::Alignment  alignment,
int  index = -1 
) [slot]

Adds a spacer to the toolbar which adjusts itself so that items added after it are aligned over the application viewport.

Parameters:
alignment The alignment to use for toolbar items. Currently supports Qt::AlignLeft and Qt::AlignCenter
index The index at which to insert the spacer. If the index is invalid (the default) the item is appended to the end of the menu.
void DzToolBar::insertViewportCenterAlignSpacer ( int  index = -1  )  [slot]

Adds a spacer to the tool bar which adjusts itself so that any items after it are centered over the application viewport.

Parameters:
index The index at which to insert the spacer. If the index is invalid (the default) the item is appended to the end of the menu.
void DzToolBar::insertViewportLeftAlignSpacer ( int  index = -1  )  [slot]

Adds a spacer to the tool bar which adjusts itself so that any items after it are left aligned over the application viewport.

Parameters:
index The index at which to insert the spacer. If the index is invalid (the default) the item is appended to the end of the menu.
DzToolBar::itemListChanged (  )  [signal]

Emitted when items are added to or removed from this toolbar

DzToolBarIterator DzToolBar::itemListIterator (  )  const
Returns:
An iterator for the items in the toolbar. If you want to iterate over all the items in the toolbar, using this function is the most efficient.
void DzToolBar::load ( QDomElement &  elem  )  [slot]

Populates this toolbar with items generated from the data in the given DOM (Document Object Model) element. This is used for building toolbars from XML. This function is intended for internal use, and so is not supported as part of the SDK.

Parameters:
elem The DOM element which defines this toolbar.
void DzToolBar::removeItem ( DzToolBarItem *  item  )  [slot]
Parameters:
item The item to remove.
void DzToolBar::removeItem ( int  index  )  [slot]
Parameters:
index The index of the item to remove.
void DzToolBar::saveToolBar ( QDomDocument &  doc,
QDomElement &  parent 
) const [slot]

Adds the DOM representation of this toolbar, and its items to the DOM document as a child of the given element. This function is intended for internal use, and is not supported as part of the SDK.

Parameters:
doc The document to save the toolbar to.
parent The element in the document that this toolbar's data will be made a child of.
void DzToolBar::undock ( QPoint &  pos  )  [slot]

Undocks the tool bar, moves it to the given global coordinates, and shows the tool bar if it is hidden.
